entry.title: Proof-of-work based signet faucet
entry.summary: The content provided illustrates a user's experience with using the `signet` feature of Bitcoin for managing and claiming digital assets. Initially, the user shares a successful claim command with a maximum difficulty of 25, highlighted by a successful transaction ID. However, an attempt to claim with a maximum difficulty of 16 results in an error due to the minimum difficulty requirement being 24, indicating that the system has predefined rules for transaction complexities. Subsequently, adjusting the claim to match the minimum difficulty criteria successfully processes another transaction, as evidenced by the provided transaction ID. This exchange reflects the operational nuances of the Bitcoin `signet`, demonstrating the importance of adhering to difficulty settings for successful transactions.
